kieker.analysis.stage.adaptation.events

Class TcpActivationControlEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • kieker.analysis.stage.adaptation.events.AbstractTcpControlEvent
      • kieker.analysis.stage.adaptation.events.TcpActivationControlEvent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TcpActivationParameterControlEvent

    public class TcpActivationControlEvent
extends AbstractTcpControlEvent
    Represents an event for the activation of a probe via TCP.
    Since:
    1.15
    Author:
    Marc Adolf

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TcpActivationControlEvent(java.lang.String ip, int port, java.lang.String hostname, java.lang.String pattern, long triggerTimestamp)
      Creates a complete activation control event.
      TcpActivationControlEvent(java.lang.String pattern, long triggerTimestamp)
      Creates a new activation control event without content except the pattern.

      • Methods inherited from class kieker.analysis.stage.adaptation.events.AbstractTcpControlEvent

    • Constructor Detail

      • TcpActivationControlEvent

        public TcpActivationControlEvent(java.lang.String ip,
                                 int port,
                                 java.lang.String hostname,
                                 java.lang.String pattern,
                                 long triggerTimestamp)
        Creates a complete activation control event.
        Parameters:
        ip - Address of the monitored application.
        port - Port of the TCP controller.
        hostname - The name of the component which is using this IP and port.
        pattern - The pattern of the method that should be monitored.
        triggerTimestamp - original trigger timestamp

      • TcpActivationControlEvent

        public TcpActivationControlEvent(java.lang.String pattern,
                                 long triggerTimestamp)
        Creates a new activation control event without content except the pattern.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern of the method that should be monitored.
        triggerTimestamp - original trigger timestamp
